result.execSummary:
The defendant Markell L Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, surcharges, each count.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol, unless medically assisted treatment.
No contact with the victim(s) or their family members without prior Court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.
No unsupervised contact with children under 18 years of age.
Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.

Sex offender assessment. Follow through with recommended programming.
Successfully comlpete Batterers Intervention cousneling and continue programming.
Cognitive Intervention Programming.
Pay supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervison  apply to all counts.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with:  Concurrent. Credit for 214 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent. Credit for 214 days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Markell L Greer in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Markell L Greer in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Cornetta S., Priscella S. and Michael H.
COUNT 1 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 45 YEARS, with credit for 214 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT 2 - CONSECUTIVE:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 40 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT 6, 7 & 8 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 214 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim(s) or their family members without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* No unsupervised contact with children under 18 years of age.
* Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
 
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
(2)Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
DEFENDANT'S SENTENCING MEMORANDUM, received and filed. lms

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Markell L Greer not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is in trial.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 6.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

from victim's brother filed.
jad

AS TO ALL COUNTS OF AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may not possess firearms and body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case adjourned for final pretrial in Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Per e-mail between this clerk and counsel, case is adjourned to 5-28-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 10.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 01/20/2015 received and filed. (21 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Calvin Malone, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Troy Porter-MPD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.

Defendant Markell L Greer in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Markell L Greer in custody.  Grant Huebner for Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order (TO APPLY IN CUSTODY AS WELL AS A CONDITION OF BOND).  Defendant to have no contact with Alejandra F., "SF" (juvenile), Clarice E. and their family members and family and known associates of deceased, Nevelo S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Markell L Greer in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Markell L Greer in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
